14792C32055D4A21BFA49FA7D41AC91F.description: Communicate a sequence of two steps for a given purpose.

B421FDEA4ABD4988B49B24DCEAF0DE22.description: Identify differences in outcomes when the order of two steps is changed.

6BEC114A9AC8441F9DBE19AED0020729.description: Follow a sequence of two steps related to a learning experience.

F7251680F503477FB0C4B608FAA0EDA7.description: Engage in activities that involve following instructions presented in various ways.

27E636857B0C492CB0A6A6434820D1BF.description: Identify instructions that help keep people safe in various contexts.

A28C55677EC94A3882D6F14FC3FC17BE.description: Engage in activities that involve following instructions in various contexts.

3BB9E474B1034EDDB94F570576897020.description: Match an action to the corresponding instruction.

52BF1A6A35F94963AC5985589179F1F4.description: Recognize when actions do not correspond to instructions.

8611648E5BF14AC696E0A84A16562332.description: The order in which instructions are followed can affect the outcome.

6BE54451A05B48AF98D708C526C755B3.description: Following instructions can help people be safe, complete a task, and know what to do.

8BC3AFB037354230B9AE91B9188180DB.description: Instructions have one or more steps.

95E4EB5EB0644CC3A7317041CEA93AEE.description: Instructions can be given in many ways and presented through speaking, pictures, gestures and traditional teachings

6E2BF14FA19243F8A2AD0B815CECA2F7.description: Instructions may be experienced in many different contexts, such as home, learning environments, games experiences in nature

C8E6D1E6990A493D852AC0C89AB85BEC.description: Instructions are directions that can be followed.

5D63997347CC4D72A1270BDF1E9D989A.description: Children interpret instructions in various environments.

071F9D02B25640859A52163AC886A321.description: Reflect on what is personally considered to be beautiful and appreciated in nature.

7E13F868D46243D290C7FEE796E92E39.description: Identify physical locations, objects, and experiences in nature that can lead to personal feelings of connection.

F833CB48055B46088921D27BEB861370.description: Identify ways to protect and respect environments.

FEE30F3F261E4AC69669510032A8F07C.description: Discuss the importance of protecting and respecting environments.

935BDF5C5C0D4820A92300F28332E00C.description: Record observations of changes in environments.

D561A1837C634DF7BE48F85172E79D98.description: Observe a variety of local environments over time.

562BB2CC08E24764BCF5B049C9D3457D.description: Identify natural and constructed objects in surrounding environments.

1689DF84DA5E4992AC57562B010F4F73.description: Represent a local environment in nature.

B3A926BF958249EA84C0131E5B554416.description: Demonstrate respect while interacting with environments.

9502CF73003D4EEFB1C22EE698351996.description: Use the senses to make observations about environments.

3BDC9BFC62A341878DCC575AC87A4EE4.description: First Nations, Métis, and Inuit ways of living connect to nature and the land.

AF964E997D674031A6D7AE9A2B396E6C.description: Feelings of connection and appreciation can be experienced in nature.

D157130EDC0445F496127C587D7A2617.description: Environments are important and should be protected and respected.

0DB85D2CB90E479596134A3952416199.description: Environments are shared spaces that include a variety of objects.

873426DB1BD7425FB650A64DD3016118.description: Environments can be explored and wondered about.

521AD48E8F2E48A6A6A21426814C7B2B.description: First Nations, Métis, and Inuit ways of living include hunting, gathering, trapping, fishing and ceremonies

F27330586C8C48CAA33B3D342AF18C0D.description: Connections can be fostered by physical locations, objects, and experiences in nature.

A97351F11A2D4A20BEE8D043A583BB8F.description: Environments can be respected in many ways, such as not littering and caring for nature

0BBB96A57F4F4E1E9F21CCD2A3E31ED6.description: Environments can be protected in many ways, such as reducing waste, reusing and recycling

28B8393ED0604E48924A8A509DADFBB5.description: Changes can be observed in environments, such as temperature; e.g., hot, cold , sunlight; e.g., cloudy, sunny, day, night, human-made structures; e.g., new playground in a park, animals growing; e.g., tadpole becoming a frog and plants growing; e.g., grass getting taller

AD671C071D3D497BA506D531FD6D21F7.description: Objects in environments can be natural or constructed by humans.

5A34C6427F1A4DFAB13ED5B265026B4F.description: Environments can be explored using the senses.

DD58608443F64F71839F19D024A88F47.description: Environments include plants, humans, and other animals.

A32624444E144A7F85EEA1A6F17E23A2.description: Children examine and describe surrounding environments.

5F256657ED924390952C2C843106502B.description: Earth Systems: Understandings of the living world, Earth, and space are deepened by investigating natural systems and their interactions.

359B0004FF014F2F89D01CCA3FC48218.description: Examine the reasons why humans and other animals move.

86AB89C9A05F427E8F6D84B297EC969D.description: Identify various ways that humans and other animals can move.

99B7F5EDAB244E0498D627801D15BA55.description: Observe and imitate how animals can move.

3CA0D4F42E764A99854F2189DDBFC8C5.description: Identify objects that do not move.

181BD5E6BFBB46429C1BE42EF30AECBC.description: Objects can be moved in various ways, including straight lines, curves, circles, back and forth, zigzags, up and down and fast and slow

32C8A7DAA21F4B52A14D32CB52A40EA7.description: Objects may be similar in one or more properties and different in another property.

21DED64C1F1B48FE87DFB3D64D25E007.description: Properties of objects that can be perceived using one or more of the five senses include colour; e.g., blue, yellow, size; e.g., long, short, shape; e.g., round, square, texture; e.g., rough, smooth, temperature; e.g., hot, cold, sound; e.g., loud, quiet, scent; e.g., fresh, rotten and taste; e.g., sweet, sour

E41B09F424A5467DAE70590D042C2410.description: The five senses are sight, touch, hearing, smell and taste

6EF437D0F1BF48DFAACFA08D96BC798B.description: An object is anything that can be perceived using one or more of the five senses.

3B76C96A2A504AA88C2356780DE29831.description: Energy: Understandings of the physical world are deepened by investigating matter and energy.
